WorkItem.Description:
Hello, I am trying to save a bitmap of the following svg file but all I get is a black / blank image.  I am using the Svg.dll in C# 4.0.
 
This same file could be converted just fine with Batik through command line with this command: 
 
java -jar batik-rasterizer.jar -m image/png  test.svg
 
 
 
<?xml version="1.0" standalone="no"?>
<svg 
  width="1200px" 
  height="1200px" 
  contentStyleType="text/css"  
  preserveAspectRatio="xMidYMid meet" 
  zoomAndPan="magnify" 
  xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" 
  xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" 
  xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" >
 
  <g transform="translate(600,600)">
 
    <text x="0" y="-250" fill="black" font-family="Verdana" text-anchor="middle" font-size="30">
      <tspan id="TopStraightText">test</tspan>
    </text>
 
    <path id="topOutterCircle" d="M -400,0 A 400,400 00 0 1 400,0"  fill="none"/>
    <text text-anchor="middle" font-size="40">
      <textPath xlink:href="#topOutterCircle" startOffset="50%">
        <tspan id="OutterTopCircularText">test</tspan>
      </textPath>
    </text>
 
    <text x="0" y="-280" fill="black" font-family="Verdana" dy="0" font-size="80" text-anchor="middle" >
      <tspan id="TopStraightBarcode">test</tspan>
    </text>
 
    <path id="bottomInnerCircle" d="M -270,0 A 100,100 00 0 0 270,0"  fill="none"/>
    <text text-anchor="middle" font-size="40">
      <textPath xlink:href="#bottomInnerCircle" startOffset="50%">
        <tspan id="InnerBottomCircularText">test</tspan>
      </textPath>
    </text>
 
    <path id="bottomOutterCircle" d="M -400,0 A 400,400 00 0 0 400,0"  fill="none"/>
    <text text-anchor="middle" font-size="40">
      <textPath xlink:href="#bottomOutterCircle" startOffset="50%">
        <tspan id="OutterBottomCircularText">test</tspan>
      </textPath>
    </text>
 
  </g>
</svg>
WorkItem.Summary: Getting a black/blank Bitmap on file with textPath tags

Comments.Message: Did you ever find a solution for this problem? As i am facing the same issue. Any help would be appreciated.
